docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Re ''Aloft on Bozoloft,'' by Maureen Dowd (column, July 3): Ms. Dowd does a disservice to the many Americans who have a diagnosis of major depressive disorder. In the last 15 years, many sufferers have been helped with the use of newer drugs like Zoloft. Unfortunately, for many the medicines stop working; others still wait for an effective treatment and lose their ability to care for themselves, enjoy life and work, and relate to their families. For some, suicide is seen as the only option.
docs.abstract: Letter from Lisa Zoldan says attitudes like those conveyed in Maureen Dowd's July 3 column contribute to ignorance of public about mental illness and provide easy excuse for politicians to side with insurance companies and not pass mental health parity act
